data.title: Copy target files of symbolic links
data.body:
This change copies target files of symlinks in the template.

Package maintainers in UN*X OS may want to use files which are contained in distribution's packages to shrink the package.
For example in debian, Ren'Py has MTLc3m.ttf in Japanese template, but it also contained in fonts-motoya-l-cedar package. However, if they replace it using symlink, the launcher will create the symlink instead of the real font.

data.title: Drag&Drop | Erroneous coordinates after a screen Hide/Show
data.body:
Info + Instructions to replicate here:

http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=32&t=27191

data.title: Same tag screens are shown at the same time
data.body:
If "use" is used in a screen, same tag screens are shown at the same time.

For examaple, show "AAA" screen and put mouse on the mousearea, then "BBB"s is shown at center
and right at the same time.

```
screen AAA:
    use BBB(atl=center)
    mousearea:
        area (0, 0, 1280, 170)
        hovered Show("BBB", atl=right)
        unhovered Show("BBB", atl=left)

screen BBB(atl):
    tag test
    vbox:
        at atl
        textbutton "BBB" action NullAction

transform left:
    xalign 0
transform right:
    xalign 1.0
transform center:
    xalign .5
```

data.title: The sav
data.body:
If "use" is used in a screen, same tag screens are shown at the same time.

For examaple, show "AAA" screen and put mouse on the mousearea, then "BBB"s is shown at center 
and right at the same time.

```
screen AAA:
    use BBB(atl=center)
    mousearea:
        area (0, 0, 1280, 170)
        hovered Show("BBB", atl=right)
        unhovered Show("BBB", atl=left)

screen BBB(atl):
    tag test
    vbox:
        at atl
        textbutton "BBB" action NullAction

transform left:
    xalign 0
transform right:
    xalign 1.0
transform center:
    xalign .5
```

data.title: Outdated documentation on Android
data.body: The documentation (https://github.com/renpy/renpy/blob/master/sphinx/source/android-packaging.rst#step-1-installing-the-dependencies and https://github.com/renpy/renpy/blob/master/sphinx/source/android.rst#android) says that the RAPT should be downloaded separately, but that's no more necessary.

data.title: Viewports jump on Android.
data.body: http://lemmasoft.renai.us/forums/viewtopic.php?f=32&t=27044&p=327682#p327652

data.title: add Eval Action
data.body:
I added Eval Action. This Action allows an optional string to be run as a expression.

```
class Eval(Action):
    """
    :doc: other_action

    This Action runs a expression and returns the result of it.

    `expression`
        This is a string giving a expression to be run.
    """
```

data.title: Fix typos in the documentation
data.body: Scan all words using enchant spell checker and fix them

data.title: Update screens.rpy
data.body: fixed the path where Ren'Py had the wrong path for the arabic font AdvertisingBold.ttf which created an error message while trying to access "Options" from the inside the game.

data.title: We should support webms with an alpha channel.
Playing movie has audio lag
data.body:
I played a movie by renpy.movie_cutscene().
But movie lags behind audio about 0.3~0.5 seconds.
This occurs in v6.15.7, but doesn't in v6.14.1

This is a sample
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/122050682/aid_in_r_t.mkv

data.title: Update-es
data.body: Spanish translation has been updated.

data.title: add Function Action
data.body:
This Action allows functions that take arguments to be used as Action.

```
class Function(Action):
    """
    :doc: other_action

    This Action calls `callable` with `args` and `kwargs`.

    `callable`
        Callable object.
    `args`
        position arguments to be passed to `callable`.
    `kwargs`
        keyword arguments to be passed to `callable`.
    """
```

data.title: fix doc
data.body:
Fixed doc.

```
     If true, events are passed to the child of this transform. If false,
-    events are blocked. (This can be used in ATL transitions to prevent
+    events are blocked. (This can be used in ATL transforms to prevent
     events from reaching the old_widget.)
```

data.title: Going fullscreen causes several window open/closes before succeeding
data.body:
From one of our testers:

> Switching to fullscreen mode makes the window open and close a few times before succeeding.

Configuration:

> Hardware: Toshiba Satellite C665
> CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-2450M CPU @ 2.50 GHz
> RAM: 4 GB
> GPU: Nvidia GeForce 315M
> OS: Windows 7

Will post log.txt when available.

data.title: fix doc about LiveComposite
data.body:
Fix typo

```
 def LiveComposite(size, *args, **properties):

 """
 -    :args: disp_imagelike
 +    :doc: disp_imagelike
```

&&

```
-    `enter_time_warp`
+    `leave_time_warp`
     A time warp function that's applied to images leaving the scene.
```

data.title: loop/noloop ignored for 'play sound' statement.
data.body:
```
play sound "test.wav" loop
```

The sound doesn't loop. loop/noloop works for the 'play music' statement, however.
The same may also be true of 'queue sound'.

data.title: Small fix for newline_indent behavior.
data.body:
Small fix for newline_indent behavior.
Now should work as described in documentation ( http://www.renpy.org/doc/html/style_properties.html#style-property-newline_indent )
Before if newline_indent was set to True newlines started with no indentation.

data.title: Solids, some ATL anims tinted blue on Lion in software renderer
data.body:
The following code:
    show expression Solid('#000',xmaximum=100, ymaximum=100, yalign=.5)
will show a blue square in 6.17.6 if I start a game in Lion on my test Mac Mini with the software renderer.

![renpy-blue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4422093/3156859/eababaaa-eae8-11e3-943a-89d549d0bdcd.png)

Trying various versions of Ren'Py, test distributions built with 6.12.0e and 6.13.8.1675 rendered correctly, while test distributions built with 6.17.6, 6.14.1, and 6.15.4 showed the blue effect.

I also noticed blueshifting of images during fades in Black Closet.

data.title: Need some sort of renpy.pin_screen/renpy.unpin_screen
data.body:
The equivalent of the pin cache functions, but for screens.

Also, re-documente the pin cache.

data.title: Only consider unique image attributes when determining best match.
data.body: This fixes cases where `tag attr1 attr2` and `tag attr2 attr2` are given equal precedence and thus cause an ambiguity error.

data.title: Restart interaction when MixerValue value changes.
data.body: This allows UIs which rely on the mixer value for other UI elements to be properly updated as the value changes.

data.title: renpy.predict() only predicts the first when called multiple times
data.body:
```
label start:
    show screen _image_load_log
    "Testing"
    $renpy.predict("red.png")
    $renpy.predict("green.png")
    $renpy.predict("blue.png")
    "You've created a new Ren'Py game."
    "Once you add a story, pictures, and music, you can release it to the world!"
    return
```

Only red.png is loaded. If red.png has already been loaded after reading that block of predicts but green.png hasn't, green.png will be loaded instead.

data.title: Screen prediction of user-shown screens does not work
data.body:
```
screen red:
    add "red.png"

label start:
    show screen _image_load_log
    "You've created a new Ren'Py game."
    show screen red
    "Once you add a story, pictures, and music, you can release it to the world!"

    return
```

red.png is not predicted, and is only loaded when the screen is shown.
Calling renpy.predict_screen("red") does not cause ren'py to load red.png either.

On the other hand, screens like say get predicted correctly.

Using renpy.predict_screen("red") appears to result in no output in image_cache.txt. The attempted automatic prediction of "red" results in the following exception:

```
Predict screen None
While predicting screen None {}
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "D:\apps\renpy\renpy\display\predict.py", line 147, in prediction_coroutine
    renpy.display.screen.predict_screen(name, *args, **kwargs)
  File "D:\apps\renpy\renpy\display\screen.py", line 543, in predict_screen
    name = tuple(name.split())
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'split'
```

This appears to be due to this code in common/000statements.rpy:

```
    def predict_screen(p):
        if not p["arguments"]:
            renpy.predict_screen(p["arguments"])
```

I have not yet determined why renpy.predict_screen() does not work- however, it seems to be being called before predict.reset() is called, but after the prediction coroutine has finished.

data.title: Unicode sound filenames don't work
data.body:
```
play sound ".ogg"
```

or

```
play sound u".ogg"
```

  File "sound.pyx", line 84, in pysdlsound.sound.play (gen\pysdlsound.sound.c:1168)
UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode characters in position 0-2: ordinal not in range(128)

data.title: RAPT should take .pyos from Ren'Py.
data.body: This way, if someone updates their Ren'Py build, they get the new .pyos automatically.
